text:
Early parliamentary general election
	An early parliamentary general election is to take place on 12 December2019 in consequence of the passing of this Act.
	That day is to be treated as a polling day appointed under section 2(7) ofthe Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011.
	This early parliamentary general election is to be treated as taking placein accordance with section 2 of that Act for the purposes of—
		section 96A(9) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 (benefit cap: review), and
		section 23(8) of the Small Business, Enterprise and Employment Act 2015(duty on Secretary of State to publish reports on economic impact on businessactivities of regulatory provisions).
	For the purposes of regulation 29(4) of the Representation of the People(Scotland) Regulations 2001 ([S.I. 2001/497](/id/uksi/2001/497?view=plain "Goto item of legislation")) (which sets out a period for objecting toapplications for registration), regulation 8(3) of those Regulations appliesas if 2 December 2019 were not a bank holiday.
Commencement and short title
	This Act comes into force on the day it is passed.
	This Act may be cited as the Early Parliamentary General Election Act 2019.
